Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that abstracts and manages the whole world as a grid of Cells.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double cellSize 
      protected int columns 
      protected Angle direction 
      protected Cell[][] grid 
      protected double laser 
      protected double noiseDirection 
      protected double noiseOdom 
      protected int numberObstacles 
      protected double odometry 
      protected double readTheta 
      protected int robotX 
      protected int robotY 
      protected int rows 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(int c, int r, double cs)
      Constructor that initializes the grid given its sizes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cellDistances(int cellX, int cellY)
      Computes the distances from a cell to its eight nearest obstacles.
      void computeDistances()
      Computes all the distances from each cell in the grid to its eight obstacles
      double distance(int cellX, int cellY, Angle angle)
      Computes the distance from a given cell to the nearest obstacle (or to the end of the grid) in the direction (angle) given
      void initializeBeliefs()
      Initializes all the cell's beliefs in an uniform way
      void markov()
      Performs a step (iteration) in the Markov localization algorithm.
      boolean moveRobot()
      Decides if the robot can be moved towards the given direction.
      void startRobot()
      Initializes all robot variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int c,
             int r,
             double cs)
        Constructor that initializes the grid given its sizes. Then, it randomly initializes the state of this World
        Parameters:
        c - -- number of columns
        r - -- number of rows
        cs - -- (geometric) size of the cell

    • Method Detail

      • startRobot

        public void startRobot()
        Initializes all robot variables. We assume that all the distances and beliefs have been computed

      • distance

        public double distance(int cellX,
                       int cellY,
                       Angle angle)
        Computes the distance from a given cell to the nearest obstacle (or to the end of the grid) in the direction (angle) given
        Parameters:
        cellX - -- the given cell's X coordinate
        cellY - -- the given cell's Y coordinate
        angle - -- direction towards the distance will be computed
        Returns:
        double -- the distance computed

      • cellDistances

        public void cellDistances(int cellX,
                          int cellY)
        Computes the distances from a cell to its eight nearest obstacles.
        Parameters:
        cellX - -- the given cell's X coordinate
        cellY - -- the given cell's Y coordinate

      • computeDistances

        public void computeDistances()
        Computes all the distances from each cell in the grid to its eight obstacles

      • initializeBeliefs

        public void initializeBeliefs()
        Initializes all the cell's beliefs in an uniform way

      • moveRobot

        public boolean moveRobot()
        Decides if the robot can be moved towards the given direction. If so, moves the robot randomly
        Returns:
        boolean -- true iff the robot did actually move

      • markov

        public void markov()
        Performs a step (iteration) in the Markov localization algorithm. We assume that all the beliefs have been initialized and the distances have been computed already.
